results.title: Metformin Inhibits NLR Family Pyrin Domain Containing 3 (NLRP)-Relevant Neuroinflammation via an Adenosine-5'-Monophosphate-Activated Protein Kinase (AMPK)-Dependent Pathway to Alleviate Early Brain Injury After Subarachnoid Hemorrhage in Mice

citations.NLM: Jin L, Jin F, Guo S, Liu W, Wei B, Fan H, Li G, Zhang X, Su S, Li R, Fang D, Duan C, Li X. Metformin Inhibits NLR Family Pyrin Domain Containing 3 (NLRP)-Relevant Neuroinflammation via an Adenosine-5'-Monophosphate-Activated Protein Kinase (AMPK)-Dependent Pathway to Alleviate Early Brain Injury After Subarachnoid Hemorrhage in Mice Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():796616. PMID: 35370693

results.title: Metformin attenuates early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via AMPK-dependent mitophagy.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ treatment after @<m>DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@ promoted mitophagy in an @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_78975 @@@AMPK@@@-dependent manner.

citations.NLM: Zhang Y, Zhang T, Li Y, Guo Y, Liu B, Tian Y, Wu P, Shi H. Metformin attenuates early brain injury after subarachnoid hemorrhage in rats via AMPK-dependent mitophagy. Exp Neurol. 2022 Jul;353():114055. PMID: 35341746

results.title: Neuropharmacological efficacy of metformin for stroke in rodents: A meta-analysis of preclinical trials
results.text_hl: The search was designed using the terms "[@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (Title/Abstract)] AND [@DISEASE_Cerebral_Hemorrhage @DISEASE_MESH:D002543 @@@Cerebral Hemorrhage@@@ (Title/Abstract) OR @DISEASE_Cerebral_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D002544 @@@Ischemic Stroke@@@ (Title/Abstract) OR @<m>DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@Subarachnoid Hemorrhage@@@ (Title/Abstract)]," as shown in Supplementary File S1.

citations.NLM: Fu W, Tang Y, Che X, Tan J, Ma Y, He Z. Neuropharmacological efficacy of metformin for stroke in rodents: A meta-analysis of preclinical trials Front Pharmacol. 2022;13():1009169. PMID: 36408248
